text: with Amazon chime you don't have to use
a new product to schedule meetings you
can use your familiar Google Calendar
this video shows you how to schedule
meetings with Amazon chime and Google
calendar start by launching the Amazon
chime app from the Launchpad choose
meetings and schedule a
meeting this brings up the schedule
meeting assistant Select Google Calendar
is your calendar application while you
are in the schedule meeting assistant
you can configure your meeting settings
this includes selecting dial-in numbers
for your attendance s if you have
international dials available a link is
displayed here to add countries or
toll-free options choose the link and
select dial Lins to include Amazon chime
will add them to your meeting
instructions you also select either a
personal meeting ID or a one-time
meeting ID the personal meeting ID was
assigned when you created your account
use it for internal or team meetings
this number is the same for all meetings
you schedule using Amazon chime this
makes it easier for you to remember and
to share with others
if you are scheduling back-to-back
meetings overlapping or a highly
confidential meeting choose the onetime
meeting ID Amazon chime generates a
special 10-digit pen that you can use
for a single meeting event or for a
recurring series let's go ahead and
choose a one-time meeting
ID your selections here dial in numbers
meeting IDs automatically populate the
schedule meeting instructions field
after you finalize the instructions
choose schedule with
Google a new tab is opened using your
default browser make sure this browser
is signed into your Google account
associated with the email address used
to create your Amazon chime account
notice that the guest list includes the
meet aim. AWS and pin plus 10-digit
onetime meeting ID email addresses your
meeting instructions are included in the
description now enter the
name date and time guests and recurrence
and then send the
invite
the meet aim. AWS email address enables
Amazon chime's autoc call feature when
you include this email address Amazon
chime receives the meeting name date
time and attendee
details the meeting will automatically
start for registered attendees at the
scheduled start time another thing you
can do is add Amazon chime to an
existing meeting to to do this go to the
Amazon chime app select meetings from
the Launchpad and then schedule
meeting in the calendar application drop
down choose other is your calendar
Define your meeting settings and then
choose copy associated with step two go
to your Google calendar and open the
meeting you want to
update paste the attendee details in the
add guest field and choose
add return to the Amazon chime SCH
schedule meeting assistant and copy the
meeting instructions return to Google
and paste the instructions into the
description
field then choose save and send
updates that's all there is to
scheduling meetings with Amazon chime
and
Google
